jobs.title: Account Executive (EMEA)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us

Photoroom launched in 2020 after being accepted into Y Combinator and has become the world's most popular AI photo editor over the past four years. Our goal is to create the technology allowing anyone create studio-level product images in minutes.

With over 300 million downloads and processing 5+ billion images annually, we serve both individual creators and major enterprises like Amazon, DoorDash, and Decathlon through our B2C app and B2B API solutions.

We're a profitable, remote-friendly company that has raised Series B funding and aims for 40% year-over-year growth. Our team of 100+ passionate builders focuses on craft, innovation, and collaboration, creating exceptional impact for entrepreneurs and businesses worldwide.

TL;DR

🤓 We are on the lookout for an Account Executive to join our small and impactful sales team. You will be responsible for developing strategic relationships, closing new business, and renewing and expanding existing customer relationships. You will work closely with our Head of Sales & Partnerships on identified verticals that have proven conversion rates.

💰 140-180k OTE (50 base/50 commission split) + Stock-Options/BSPCE

🇪🇺 We are flexible: you can work from anywhere in Europe, come once a month to Paris (fully reimbursed), or visit the office more often.

✈️ We offer substantial support for relocation (up to 10k€), including finding an apartment in Paris and supporting you with the visa procedure.

🛂 We currently sponsor visas for individuals relocating to France or already based here. We cannot sponsor visas for remote positions outside of France.

💻 Technology - MacBook Pro, monitor, keyboard, etc.

🏖️ Socials - Annual company retreat & quarterly kick offs in Paris

🇬🇧 Photoroom is an international team, and we work in English. We offer language lessons for those who need them (English & French).


✨ About the role ✨

  • You will oversee the full sales cycle from initial interest or hand-off from BDR to deal close.

  • You will qualify, manage, and support leads from marketing campaigns and sales opportunities, and progress opportunities through the sales process.

  • You will continuously build new pipeline and exceed assigned goals, with a focus on our API to start, and potentially expanding to web app sales.

  • You will work closely with the Head of Sales to identify client needs and provide product recommendations to our internal product and tech teams.

  • You will stay up to date with the GenAI landscape, competitive landscape, as well as our own products, services, and pricing models.

  • You will accurately log, track, and manage outbound activities, opportunities, and account information in HubSpot.

  • You will foster positive relationships with both internal teams and external prospects.

  • You will build long-term, trusted relationships with customers and partners.

✨ About you ✨

  • You have 5+ years of selling SaaS software to SMB and enterprise accounts.

  • You have owned enterprise software quotas of at least $1M+.

  • You love becoming a product and domain expert. You have a consultative approach when approaching the sales process and customers.

  • You are an excellent communicator, both written and verbal. You can easily explain the benefits of a service and can simplify complex topics in a way that anyone can understand.

  • You thrive in a fast-paced environment.

  • You have a results-driven mindset with a focus on meeting and exceeding targets.

  • You are a self-starter. You act independently when necessary, creating and executing plans for improvements and implementation.

  • You can work both independently and collaboratively as part of a dynamic team.

  • You are enthusiastic about AI and preferably have an understanding of the GenAI landscape.

  • You are fluent in English. Another language is a plus.

  • Startup sales experience is highly desirable.

If you think you have what it takes but don't meet every single point above, please still apply. We'd love to chat and see if you could be a great fit.

✨ Hiring Process ✨

  • Screening call with the Talent Manager

  • Technical interview with the Hiring Manager

  • Home technical assignment, followed by a review with the team (can be compensated and under 3h)

  • Culture fit interview and meet the team!

  • Reference check & Offer

Support - If you have a medical condition or an individual need for an adjustment to our process, and you believe this may affect your ability to be at your best, please let us know so we can talk about how we can best support you and make any adjustments that may be needed.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging

We're committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued at work. We believe our company and culture are strongest when composed of diverse experiences and backgrounds.

That's also why we have flexible working hours, trust people to work remotely, and extended parental leave.

All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

jobs.title: Senior User Researcher
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us

Photoroom launched in 2020 after being accepted into Y Combinator and has become the world's most popular AI photo editor over the past four years. Our goal is to create the technology allowing anyone create studio-level product images in minutes.

With over 300 million downloads and processing 5+ billion images annually, we serve both individual creators and major enterprises like Amazon, DoorDash, and Decathlon through our B2C app and B2B API solutions.

We're a profitable, remote-friendly company that has raised Series B funding and aims for 40% year-over-year growth. Our team of 100+ passionate builders focuses on craft, innovation, and collaboration, creating exceptional impact for entrepreneurs and businesses worldwide.

Role Summary

We're looking for a Senior User Researcher to help equip the Photoroom team with rich, actionable user insights. You'll conduct strategic user research projects with end-to-end ownership, serve as a strategic partner for stakeholders, and help build ReOps systems while collaborating closely with other researchers, product, design, growth.

Compensation: €75,000 - €90,000 + Stock-Options/BSPCE

Location: Remote across Europe/UK with quarterly Paris office visits (fully reimbursed)

About the Role

  • You will own end-to-end user research for specific strategic objectives at Photoroom. This includes defining research goals and methodology as well as fully executing projects, delivering actionable results, and working with stakeholders to implement findings.

  • In addition to doing research and delivering insights, you’ll be involved throughout the product development process as a strategic thought partner for stakeholders, ensuring user-centricity.

  • You will help design ReOps systems that make it easy and attractive for the wider team to speak to, and listen to, users.

  • You will help the team utilize AI for better quality and more efficient research processes, while keeping what needs to be human, human.

  • You will work collaboratively within a small, passionate research team, supporting each other’s growth and scaling Photoroom’s user research capabilities.

About You

  • You have at least 3 years of full-time experience as a user/UX researcher.

  • You possess strong qualitative research skills, including conducting interviews, usability testing, and qualitative data analysis.

  • You are comfortable working in a fast-paced, startup environment where research cycles are lean, collaborative, and time-sensitive.

  • You are a confident storyteller with the courage to challenge assumptions and advocate for user-centered insights.

  • You have demonstrated ability to work closely with stakeholders to identify research needs, plan research projects, and closely collaborate on the implementation of findings.

  • You are passionate about the evolving role of AI in user research and open to integrating AI tools to enhance research quality and efficiency while preserving essential human elements.

Nice to have

  • Significant experience with quantitative methodology aside from surveying, such as data analysis

  • Demonstrated ability to prototype in Figma or with AI platforms such as Cursor or Lovable

If you think you have what it takes but don't meet every single point above, please still apply. We'd love to chat and see if you could be a great fit.

Benefits

  • Work flexibly from anywhere in Europe within a 3-hour flight from Paris (HQ)

  • Regular team gatherings, including in-person onboarding in Paris (1-2 weeks), yearly company offsite and team retreat, quarterly in-person meetings (monthly during probation period), and social events like winter party and hackathons.

  • 30 days annual leave plus local public holidays

  • Competitive equity package with stock options/BSPCE, giving you ownership in our growing company

  • €1000 one-time home office grant OR €400 per month co-working space stipend

  • €1,000 annual learning and development budget for training, courses, books, and skill development

  • Private health insurance

  • Access to personalized mental health support, including 1:1 sessions with therapists or coaches, self-care tools, and well-being resources via MokaCare

  • Sports and cultural activities reimbursement

  • Relocation support (up to 10k) available for those choosing to move to France, including apartment finding and visa assistance.

Note: Visa sponsorship and relocation support are only available for positions based in France. We cannot sponsor visas for remote positions outside of France.

Hiring Process

  1. Screening call with Talent Manager (30min)

  2. Technical interview with Hiring Manager (45min)

  3. Take-home assignment and live review with the team (45min)

  4. Culture fit interviews and meet the team (~3h in total)

  5. Reference check and offer

Support: We value diversity and aim to create an inclusive experience for all applicants. Please let us know if there’s anything we can do to make the process more accessible for you.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging

We're committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued at work. We believe our company and culture are strongest when composed of diverse experiences and backgrounds.

That's also why we have flexible working hours, trust people to work remotely, and extended parental leave.

All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

  • You have experience selling an API in at least one of your experiences.

  • You have owned enterprise software quotas of at least $1M+.

  • You thrive in a fast-paced environment.

  • You have a results-driven mindset with a focus on meeting and exceeding targets.

  • You are a self-starter. You act independently when necessary, creating and executing plans for improvements and implementation.

  • You are able to work both independently and collaboratively as part of a dynamic team.

  • You are enthusiastic about AI and preferably have an understanding of the GenAI landscape.

  • You are fluent in English. Another language is a plus.

  • Startup sales experience is highly desirable.

If you think you have what it takes but don't meet every single point above, please still apply. We'd love to chat and see if you could be a great fit.

✨ Hiring Process ✨

  • Screening with the Recruiter

  • Technical interview with the Hiring Manager

  • Home technical assignment, followed by a review with the team

  • Culture fit interview and meet the team!

  • Reference check & Offer

jobs.title: Senior/Staff Applied Scientist - Relocate to Europe!
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us

Photoroom launched in 2020 after being accepted into Y Combinator and has become the world's most popular AI photo editor over the past four years. Our goal is to create the technology allowing anyone create studio-level product images in minutes.

With over 300 million downloads and processing 5+ billion images annually, we serve both individual creators and major enterprises like Amazon, DoorDash, and Decathlon through our B2C app and B2B API solutions.

We're a profitable, remote-friendly company that has raised Series B funding and aims for 40% year-over-year growth. Our team of 100+ passionate builders focuses on craft, innovation, and collaboration, creating exceptional impact for entrepreneurs and businesses worldwide.

Have you ever dreamt of working in Europe, living the Parisian dream? Now is your chance.

TL; DR 🤓

Photoroom is looking for a talented Senior Applied Scientist. You will work on several ML solutions, starting from the requirements, literature, and all the way to a product. You will own most of this process, be trusted and have your say on data acquisition, optional labelling, overall strategy and follow ups. Your work will serve millions of users, be useful and be remarked.

We are also training an open-source diffusion model from scratch, offering the opportunity to contribute to something cutting-edge and shareable with the broader ML community.

💰 Competitive salary + Stock-Options/BSPCE

🇪🇺 We are flexible: you can work from anywhere in Europe within a 3-hour flight from Paris (HQ) and come to our office once a month (fully reimbursed) or more often. This ensures effective collaboration and supports our commitment to reducing our carbon footprint.

✈️ We offer substantial support for relocation (10k€ signing bonus), including finding an apartment in Paris and supporting you with the visa procedure.

💻 Technology - new MacBook Pro, monitor, keyboard, etc.

🏖️ Socials - Quarterly company retreats, weekly Happy Hour & Game Time

🇬🇧 PhotoRoom is an international team and we work in English. We offer language lessons for those who need them (English & French).

✨ About the role ✨

  • You'll be the eleventh engineer in the ML team, working alongside great talent from various backgrounds.

  • You will have full ownership of your ML work streams when applicable, or work with teammates on big topics. You have expertise and ownership; you have a say in how that goes.

  • You will master the whole pipeline, from training models to putting them into production and monitoring their performance.

  • You will work on new features, new applications, and some 0→1 solutions.

  • You will get fast feedback from our users and will iterate quickly. You will follow the usage of the product and make decisions based on that.

  • You will work within a small multicultural team composed of ~75 passionate, friendly & committed folks.

✨ About you ✨

  • You have 3+ years of experience with PyTorch, Tensorflow or Jax, and are willing to start or keep working with PyTorch.

  • You have a deep experience with diffusion models, for image creation or edition**.** You’ve trained diffusion models from scratch, or practiced deep surgery beyond their original pre-training.

  • You are always the most pragmatic person in the room.

  • You favor speed of iteration over perfect, always leverage frameworks and libraries to avoid reinventing the wheel.

  • You have experience working on products requiring complex architectures.

  • You have a strong sense of ownership.

  • You take initiative and you are at ease to make product & technical decisions.

  • You have worked as part of a talented team and have experience in a fast-growing startup.

  • You’re curious, are comfortable with explaining or learning depending on the situation. The team has deep expertise and values knowledge sharing and humility.

  • You are fluent in English (French is not required!).

✨ Hiring Process ✨

  • Screening call with our Head of AI

  • Home technical assignment, reviewed with the team

  • Culture fit interview and meet the team!

  • Reference check & Offer

jobs.title: Senior Web Engineer, Frontend [Europe, remote]
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us

Photoroom launched in 2020 after being accepted into Y Combinator and has become the world's most popular AI photo editor over the past four years. Our goal is to create the technology allowing anyone create studio-level product images in minutes.

With over 300 million downloads and processing 5+ billion images annually, we serve both individual creators and major enterprises like Amazon, DoorDash, and Decathlon through our B2C app and B2B API solutions.

We're a profitable, remote-friendly company that has raised Series B funding and aims for 40% year-over-year growth. Our team of 100+ passionate builders focuses on craft, innovation, and collaboration, creating exceptional impact for entrepreneurs and businesses worldwide.

TL;DR

Build the web platform that powers 5 billion image transformations every year.

As a frontend engineer at Photoroom, you’ll join a 10-person web team where you'll architect scalable solutions for millions of users, integrate cutting-edge AI features, and directly shape the product that entrepreneurs worldwide rely on to create stunning visuals.

You'll work autonomously across squads, tackling challenges from real-time image manipulation to AI-powered generative tools.

  • 80k€-100k€* + Stock-Options/BSPCE

  • Full remote: you can work from anywhere in Europe within a 3-hour flight from Paris (HQ) and come to our office once per quarter (fully reimbursed).

  • We are currently unable to sponsor visas outside of France.

  • Socials - Annual company retreats, quarterly gatherings, Game Time

*We can go higher for outstanding profiles and adapt to the cost of living if it is higher than in Paris.

About the role 

Build the future of visual commerce at unprecedented scale.

Imagine writing code that directly impacts millions of entrepreneurs creating their next big product launch. You’ll work on real-time canvas manipulation, WebAssembly integration, AI-powered workflows, and performance optimization for massive visual datasets.

What makes this role extraordinary:

  • AI at the core: You'll have the best AI tools at your disposal, and the ability to focus on problem solving while AI manages what is automatable, redundant, and repetitive. You’ll also build breakthrough features based on our proprietary genAI models. Not just consuming APIs, but building the interfaces that make complex AI feel effortless

  • Technical depth: From sophisticated state management patterns with MobX to brand new features for our AI photo editor, you'll solve problems that push the boundaries of what's possible in the browser

  • Product ownership: You’ll go beyond implementation, and partner closely with our ML and product teams to help shape product strategy and build features from planning to launch and beyond

  • Real-life impact: Your work will empower millions of small businesses and creators to compete visually with major brands

Key projects you might tackle: Real-time collaborative editing, AI-powered background generation interfaces, complex image composition rendering, internal developer tools, design system architecture.

Your technical playground: React.js, TypeScript, MobX, Canvas API, WebAssembly, TailwindCSS, Turborepo, Vite, Playwright. Plus, you'll be encouraged to experiment with cutting-edge web technologies as they emerge.

About you

You're a senior (8 years+) engineer excited about complex, high-impact challenges.

You've built large-scale web applications that real people depend on. Think SaaS platforms serving 1M+ users monthly with teams of 10+ developers. You know how to maintain performance when every millisecond (and pixel!) count

What we're looking for:

  • React mastery: Deep expertise in React and component-based architecture

  • State management expertise: Strong understanding of MobX or the observer pattern, and how to use it to manage complex application state elegantly

  • Proven scale experience: You've architected applications serving 1M+ users monthly

  • Startup mindset: You favor fast iteration over perfection, can work autonomously, and understand that in a scaling startup, adaptability beats rigid process

  • AI enthusiasm: You actively use AI tools to amplify your productivity

Bonus points for: WebAssembly experience, visual tools background, Canvas/WebGL knowledge, product photography interest.

If you think you have what it takes but don't meet every single point above, please still apply. We'd love to chat and see if you could be a great fit.

Hiring Process

  • Screening call with recruiting

  • Technical interview with the team lead

  • Home technical assignment, followed by a review with the web team

  • Ways of working interviews and meet the team

  • Reference check & offer

Support - If you have a medical condition or an individual need for an adjustment to our process, and you believe this may affect your ability to be at your best - please let us know so we can talk about how we can best support you and make any adjustments that may be needed.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging

We're committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued at work. We believe our company and culture are strongest when composed of diverse experiences and backgrounds.

That's also why we have flexible working hours, trust people to work remotely, and extended parental leave.

All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

jobs.title: Business Development Representative (UKI Market)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us

Photoroom launched in 2020 after being accepted into Y Combinator and has become the world's most popular AI photo editor over the past four years. Our goal is to create the technology allowing anyone create studio-level product images in minutes.

With over 300 million downloads and processing 5+ billion images annually, we serve both individual creators and major enterprises like Amazon, DoorDash, and Decathlon through our B2C app and B2B API solutions.

We're a profitable, remote-friendly company that has raised Series B funding and aims for 40% year-over-year growth. Our team of 100+ passionate builders focuses on craft, innovation, and collaboration, creating exceptional impact for entrepreneurs and businesses worldwide.

Role Summary

We're looking for a Business Development Representative to build and scale our B2B sales pipeline. You'll identify and qualify high-value prospects in key verticals while generating 20+ qualified leads monthly for our sales team.

Compensation: €50k-65k OTE + Stock-Options/BSPCE
Location: Remote-friendly, London/Paris area with Paris office visits (fully reimbursed)

About the Role

  • Build targeted outreach campaigns across 3-5 key verticals

  • Generate qualified leads through creative, personalised outreach using Salesloft, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and ZoomInfo

  • Qualify and nurture prospects ensuring smooth handoffs to AEs

  • Collaborate with Head of Sales and BDR Team Lead to refine ideal customer profiles and messaging strategies that convert

  • Partner with marketing team to develop account-based marketing campaigns targeting enterprise prospects in your verticals

About You

  • 1+ years of BDR/SDR experience in B2B SaaS with proven track record of consistently hitting meeting and pipeline targets

  • Strong cold calling skills and phone presence: comfortable with regular cold calling as a core part of generating qualified meetings

  • Full-cycle outbound experience owning prospecting, discovery, qualification, and booking sales-ready meetings that convert to pipeline

  • Results-driven mindset focused on revenue impact: understanding that success is measured by pipeline that closes, not just meetings booked

  • Experience with modern sales tools including CRM systems (HubSpot, Salesforce), outreach platforms (Salesloft, Outreach), and prospecting tools (ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator).

  • You are a native English speaker. Another language is a plus.

If you think you have what it takes but don't meet every single point above, please still apply. We'd love to chat and see if you could be a great fit.

Hiring Process

  1. Screening call with Talent Manager (30min)

  2. Technical interview with Hiring Manager (45min)

  3. Take-home assignment (duration varies by role) and live review with the team (45min)

  4. Culture fit interviews and meet the team (~3h in total)

  5. Reference check and offer

Support: We value diversity and aim to create an inclusive experience for all applicants. Please let us know if there’s anything we can do to make the process more accessible for you.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging

We're committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued at work. We believe our company and culture are strongest when composed of diverse experiences and backgrounds.

That's also why we have flexible working hours, trust people to work remotely, and extended parental leave.

All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

Over the past 2 years, we’ve been expanding and partnering with more—and larger—Enterprise customers like Netflix, Wix, and DoorDash.

As a Solutions Engineer, you’ll play a critical role in driving the success of our Enterprise customers. You'll serve as a trusted technical partner to our Sales and Partnerships team, helping prospects and clients understand how Photoroom’s solutions can transform their visual workflows. You'll leverage our existing technical playbook and proactively contribute to its improvement.

The majority of our Enterprise customers integrate via our API, so this role requires a strong technical foundation along with the ability to communicate clearly and confidently with both developers and business stakeholders.

Compensation: €92-114k + Stock-Options/BSPCE

Location: Remote across Europe with monthly Paris office visits (fully reimbursed)

About the role

  • You will partner with the Sales team to lead technical discovery, run demos, and build proofs of concept that showcase the value of our platform.

  • You will act as a trusted technical advisor to prospective and existing enterprise customers.

  • You will design and propose tailored integration solutions based on each customer’s tech stack, goals, and product roadmap.

  • You will own the technical implementation experience—from onboarding to deployment—ensuring a smooth and efficient integration process.

  • You will create high-quality documentation, including API references, integration guides, and tutorials.

  • You will capture customer feedback and collaborate with Product and Engineering to inform our roadmap.

  • You will identify and document common use cases, integration patterns, and troubleshooting steps to enable internal teams.

About you

  • You have 5+ years of experience in a technical pre-sales, solutions engineering, or customer-facing technical role, ideally within a SaaS or API-first company.

  • You have hands-on experience working with RESTful APIs and are proficient in tools such as Postman, Swagger/OpenAPI, and basic scripting or integration logic.

  • You have hands-on coding experience with languages such as Python, JavaScript, or similar, and can write scripts, build proof-of-concept integrations, and troubleshoot technical implementations alongside customers and internal teams.

  • You’ve created technical documentation, integration guides, or implementation playbooks, and can explain complex concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.

  • You’re confident in running live demos and technical deep dives with stakeholders across engineering, product, and business functions.

  • You can independently scope and propose integration solutions based on a client’s tech stack, requirements, and constraints.

  • You have a track record of collaborating closely with engineering teams to relay customer feedback and influence the product roadmap.

  • You manage multiple projects simultaneously and consistently deliver on time with a high level of attention to detail.

  • You are fluent in English (written and spoken); fluency in other languages is a plus.

  • Bonus: You have experience with computer vision, ML-based image generation, or media infrastructure (e.g., working with images, graphics, or content delivery pipelines).

    If you think you have what it takes but don't meet every single point above, please still apply. We'd love to chat and see if you could be a great fit.

Benefits

  • Work flexibly from anywhere in Europe within a 3-hour flight from Paris (HQ)

  • Regular team gatherings, including in-person onboarding in Paris (1-2 weeks), yearly company offsite and team retreat, quarterly in-person meetings (monthly during probation period), and social events like winter party and hackathons.

  • 30 days annual leave plus local public holidays

  • Competitive equity package with stock options/BSPCE, giving you ownership in our growing company

  • €1000 one-time home office grant OR €400 per month co-working space stipend

  • €1,000 annual learning and development budget for training, courses, books, and skill development

  • Private health insurance

  • Access to personalised mental health support, including 1:1 sessions with therapists or coaches, self-care tools, and well-being resources via MokaCare

  • Sports and cultural activities reimbursement

  • Relocation support (up to 10k) available for those choosing to move to France, including apartment finding and visa assistance.

Note: Visa sponsorship and relocation support are only available for positions based in France. We cannot sponsor visas for remote positions outside of France.

Hiring Process

  1. Screening call with Talent Manager (30min)

  2. Technical interview with Hiring Manager (45min)

  3. Take-home assignment (duration varies by role) and live review with the team (45min)

  4. Culture fit interviews and meet the team (~3h in total)

  5. Reference check and offer

Support: We value diversity and aim to create an inclusive experience for all applicants. Please let us know if there’s anything we can do to make the process more accessible for you.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging

We're committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued at work. We believe our company and culture are strongest when composed of diverse experiences and backgrounds.

That's also why we have flexible working hours, trust people to work remotely, and extended parental leave.

All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

jobs.title: Senior Django Backend Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us

Photoroom launched in 2020 after being accepted into Y Combinator and has become the world's most popular AI photo editor over the past four years. Our goal is to create the technology allowing anyone create studio-level product images in minutes.

With over 300 million downloads and processing 5+ billion images annually, we serve both individual creators and major enterprises like Amazon, DoorDash, and Decathlon through our B2C app and B2B API solutions.

We're a profitable, remote-friendly company that has raised Series B funding and aims for 40% year-over-year growth. Our team of 100+ passionate builders focuses on craft, innovation, and collaboration, creating exceptional impact for entrepreneurs and businesses worldwide.

Role Summary

We're looking for a Senior Django Backend Engineer to help deliver exciting new features for our users and improve the quality of existing ones while collaborating closely with other engineers (both frontend and backend) and product owners.

Compensation: 100k £/€ + Stock-Options/BSPCE

Location: Remote across Europe with monthly Paris office visits (fully reimbursed)

About the Role

  • You will own your work from A to Z: it goes from working on the architecture & coding features to monitoring releases' performance (we use Datadog for monitoring).

  • You will get fast feedback from our users and will iterate quickly (we update the backend multiple times a week). You will follow the usage of the product and make decisions based on that.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., product, front-end) to actively help design and deliver seamless user experiences.

  • You will optimise existing endpoints, driving down latency and ensuring we can continue to scale to ever greater usages

About You

  • You have 5+ years of experience in backend development with Django and Django Rest Framework

  • You have experience working with a relational database at scale, designing schemas, optimising Django queries, and running migrations with minimal downtime

  • You have a hands-on experience with a PostgreSQL/MySQL database larger than 100 GB

  • You have experience designing endpoints in direct collaboration with frontend engineers, delivering both Open API and developer manuals/supporting documentation

  • You are always the most pragmatic person in the room. You favour speed of iteration over perfect, always leverage frameworks and libraries to avoid reinventing the wheel

  • You have a strong sense of ownership. You take initiative and you are at ease to make product & technical decisions.

  • You are fluent in English (French is not required!).

If you think you have what it takes but don't meet every single point above, please still apply. We'd love to chat and see if you could be a great fit.

Benefits

  • Work flexibly from anywhere in Europe within a 3-hour flight from Paris (HQ)

  • Regular team gatherings, including in-person onboarding in Paris (1-2 weeks), yearly company offsite and team retreat, quarterly in-person meetings (monthly during probation period), and social events like winter party and hackathons.

  • 30 days annual leave plus local public holidays

  • Competitive equity package with stock options/BSPCE, giving you ownership in our growing company

  • €1000 one-time home office grant OR €400 per month co-working space stipend

  • €1,000 annual learning and development budget for training, courses, books, and skill development

  • Private health insurance

  • Access to personalised mental health support, including 1:1 sessions with therapists or coaches, self-care tools, and well-being resources via MokaCare

  • Sports and cultural activities reimbursement

  • Relocation support (up to 10k) available for those choosing to move to France, including apartment finding and visa assistance.

Note: Visa sponsorship and relocation support are only available for positions based in France. We cannot sponsor visas for remote positions outside of France.

Hiring Process

  1. Screening call with Talent Manager (30min)

  2. Technical interview with Hiring Manager (45min)

  3. Take-home assignment (duration varies by role) and live review with the team (45min)

  4. Culture fit interviews and meet the team (~3h in total)

  5. Reference check and offer

Support: We value diversity and aim to create an inclusive experience for all applicants. Please let us know if there’s anything we can do to make the process more accessible for you.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging

We're committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued at work. We believe our company and culture are strongest when composed of diverse experiences and backgrounds.

That's also why we have flexible working hours, trust people to work remotely, and extended parental leave.

All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.
